title: Remove sprint_threshold - consolidate into filters
description: Remove sprint_threshold from JiraConfig. Sprint assignment should be controlled by filters instead - if a vulnerability passes filters, it goes to the sprint. This consolidates filtering logic in one place.
close_reason: Removed sprint_threshold from JiraConfig. All vulnerabilities that pass filters are now added to the active sprint.

title: rename filters.min_severity
description:
filters.min_severity can be confusing which severity this means (a user might mistake this as whether this is for jira or vulnerability). I was thinking of renaming this to `filters.vuln_threshold` which:
  1. communicates this is a vulnerability severity/threshold
  2. threshold communicates what this means a little better than min does
close_reason: Renamed min_severity to severity_threshold across codebase

title: add assignee map to config and config validation to startup
close_reason: Implemented: Added users map to defaults.jira for alias-to-Jira-ID mapping, ResolveUserID method, and updated AssigneeResolver to resolve aliases

title: Add per-repo/project filter overrides
description: Add Filters field to RepoInclude struct so each repo/project can override filter settings (min_severity, cvss_min, etc.) similar to how assignee overrides work.
close_reason: Added Filters field to RepoInclude struct and GetRepoFilter method with hierarchy: defaults → provider → repo.

title: Move example config to separate file using embed
description: Move the exampleConfig constant from cmd/config.go to a separate configs/example.yaml file. Use Go's embed directive to include it at compile time for easier maintenance.

title: create golangci-lint config yaml
description: create an initial well thoughtout golangci-lint yaml that would be appropriate for an opensource project
close_reason: Created .golangci.yml with golangci-lint v2 format. Includes: errcheck, govet, staticcheck, unused, gocritic, gocyclo, revive, misspell, gosec, errorlint, nilerr, prealloc, copyloopvar, bodyclose, noctx. Also configured gofmt/goimports formatters.

title: move example config to a template
description:
in cmd/config.go we currently use the initial config like this:
```go
const exampleConfig = `# Argus Configuration
# Base provider config (inherited by all providers)
```
which is then used in:
```go
if err := os.WriteFile(filename, []byte(exampleConfig), 0644); err != nil {
		return fmt.Errorf("failed to write config file: %w", err)
	}
```
to init the config from that string. I would like this to be moved to a template. There is also config.example.yaml that is largely a replica of the in-code config. Supporting both is going to be painful to keep consistent with updates and I would prefer a single place where the example config lives
close_reason: Moved example config to cmd/configs/example.yaml and using Go embed directive. Deleted outdated config.example.yaml.
